trans-unit.source: Used to select or deselect action items.
trans-unit.target: Used to select or deselect action items.

trans-unit.source: Can be used for a single list item or for multiple list items.
trans-unit.target: Can be used for a single list item or for multiple list items.

trans-unit.source: Check boxes
trans-unit.target: Check boxes

trans-unit.source: Check boxes
trans-unit.target: Check boxes

trans-unit.source: A check box is used to select or deselect action items.
trans-unit.target: A check box is used to select or deselect action items.

trans-unit.source: It can be used for a single item or for a list of multiple items that a user can choose from.
trans-unit.target: It can be used for a single item or for a list of multiple items that a user can choose from.

trans-unit.source: The control has three selection states: unselected, selected, and indeterminate.
trans-unit.target: The control has three selection states: unselected, selected, and indeterminate.

trans-unit.source: Use the indeterminate state when a collection of sub-choices have both unselected and selected states.
trans-unit.target: Use the indeterminate state when a collection of sub-choices have both unselected and selected states.

trans-unit.source: Example of check box states
trans-unit.target: Example of check box states

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: CheckBox class
trans-unit.target: CheckBox class

trans-unit.source: Checked event
trans-unit.target: Checked event

trans-unit.source: IsChecked property
trans-unit.target: IsChecked property

trans-unit.source: Is this the right control?
trans-unit.target: Is this the right control?

trans-unit.source: Use a **single check box** for a binary yes/no choice, such as with a "Remember me?"
trans-unit.target: Use a **single check box** for a binary yes/no choice, such as with a "Remember me?"

trans-unit.source: login scenario or with a terms of service agreement.
trans-unit.target: login scenario or with a terms of service agreement.

trans-unit.source: A single check box used for an individual choice
trans-unit.target: A single check box used for an individual choice

trans-unit.source: For a binary choice, the main difference between a **check box** and a **toggle switch** is that the check box is for status and the toggle switch is for action.
trans-unit.target: For a binary choice, the main difference between a **check box** and a **toggle switch** is that the check box is for status and the toggle switch is for action.

trans-unit.source: You can delay committing a check box interaction (as part of a form submit, for example), while you should immediately commit a toggle switch interaction.
trans-unit.target: You can delay committing a check box interaction (as part of a form submit, for example), while you should immediately commit a toggle switch interaction.

trans-unit.source: Also, only check boxes allow for multi-selection.
trans-unit.target: Also, only check boxes allow for multi-selection.

trans-unit.source: Use **multiple check boxes** for multi-select scenarios in which a user chooses one or more items from a group of choices that are not mutually exclusive.
trans-unit.target: Use **multiple check boxes** for multi-select scenarios in which a user chooses one or more items from a group of choices that are not mutually exclusive.

trans-unit.source: Create a group of check boxes when users can select any combination of options.
trans-unit.target: Create a group of check boxes when users can select any combination of options.

trans-unit.source: Selecting multiple options with check boxes
trans-unit.target: Selecting multiple options with check boxes

trans-unit.source: When options can be grouped, you can use an indeterminate check box to represent the whole group.
trans-unit.target: When options can be grouped, you can use an indeterminate check box to represent the whole group.

trans-unit.source: Use the check box's indeterminate state when a user selects some, but not all, sub-items in the group.
trans-unit.target: Use the check box's indeterminate state when a user selects some, but not all, sub-items in the group.

trans-unit.source: Check boxes used to show a mixed choice
trans-unit.target: Check boxes used to show a mixed choice

trans-unit.source: Both **check box** and **radio button** controls let the user select from a list of options.
trans-unit.target: Both **check box** and **radio button** controls let the user select from a list of options.

trans-unit.source: Check boxes let the user select a combination of options.
trans-unit.target: Check boxes let the user select a combination of options.

trans-unit.source: In contrast, radio buttons let the user make a single choice from mutually exclusive options.
trans-unit.target: In contrast, radio buttons let the user make a single choice from mutually exclusive options.

trans-unit.source: When there is more than one option but only one can be selected, use a radio button instead.
trans-unit.target: When there is more than one option but only one can be selected, use a radio button instead.

trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: Create a checkbox
trans-unit.target: Create a checkbox

trans-unit.source: To assign a label to the checkbox, set the [**Content**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.contentcontrol.content.aspx) property.
trans-unit.target: To assign a label to the checkbox, set the [**Content**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.contentcontrol.content.aspx) property.

trans-unit.source: The label displays next to the checkbox.
trans-unit.target: The label displays next to the checkbox.

trans-unit.source: This XAML creates a single check box that is used to agree to terms of service before a form can be submitted.
trans-unit.target: This XAML creates a single check box that is used to agree to terms of service before a form can be submitted.

trans-unit.source: Here's the same check box created in code.
trans-unit.target: Here's the same check box created in code.

trans-unit.source: Bind to IsChecked
trans-unit.target: Bind to IsChecked

trans-unit.source: Use the [**IsChecked**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.primitives.togglebutton.ischecked.aspx) property to determine whether the check box is checked or cleared.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**IsChecked**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.primitives.togglebutton.ischecked.aspx) property to determine whether the check box is checked or cleared.

trans-unit.source: You can bind the value of the IsChecked property to another binary value.
trans-unit.target: You can bind the value of the IsChecked property to another binary value.

trans-unit.source: However, because IsChecked is a [nullable](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/b3h38hb0.aspx) boolean value, you must use a value converter to bind it to a boolean value.
trans-unit.target: However, because IsChecked is a [nullable](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/b3h38hb0.aspx) boolean value, you must use a value converter to bind it to a boolean value.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the **IsChecked** property of the check box to agree to terms of service is bound to the [**IsEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.control.isenabled.aspx) property of a Submit button.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the **IsChecked** property of the check box to agree to terms of service is bound to the [**IsEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.control.isenabled.aspx) property of a Submit button.

trans-unit.source: The Submit button is enabled only if the terms of service are agreed to.
trans-unit.target: The Submit button is enabled only if the terms of service are agreed to.

trans-unit.source: Note  We only show the relevant code here.
trans-unit.target: Note  We only show the relevant code here.

trans-unit.source: For more info about data binding and value converters, see [Data binding overview](../data-binding/data-binding-quickstart.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info about data binding and value converters, see [Data binding overview](../data-binding/data-binding-quickstart.md).

trans-unit.source: Handle Click and Checked events
trans-unit.target: Handle Click and Checked events

trans-unit.source: To perform an action when the check box state changes, you can handle either the [**Click**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.primitives.buttonbase.click.aspx) event, or the [**Checked**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.primitives.togglebutton.checked.aspx) and [**Unchecked**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.primitives.togglebutton.unchecked.aspx) events.
trans-unit.target: To perform an action when the check box state changes, you can handle either the [**Click**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.primitives.buttonbase.click.aspx) event, or the [**Checked**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.primitives.togglebutton.checked.aspx) and [**Unchecked**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.primitives.togglebutton.unchecked.aspx) events.

trans-unit.source: The **Click** event occurs whenever the checked state changes.
trans-unit.target: The **Click** event occurs whenever the checked state changes.

trans-unit.source: If you handle the Click event, use the **IsChecked** property to determine the state of the check box.
trans-unit.target: If you handle the Click event, use the **IsChecked** property to determine the state of the check box.

trans-unit.source: The **Checked** and **Unchecked** events occur independently.
trans-unit.target: The **Checked** and **Unchecked** events occur independently.

trans-unit.source: If you handle these events, you should handle both of them to repsond to state changes in the check box.
trans-unit.target: If you handle these events, you should handle both of them to repsond to state changes in the check box.

trans-unit.source: In the following examples, we show handling the Click event, and the Checked and Unchecked events.
trans-unit.target: In the following examples, we show handling the Click event, and the Checked and Unchecked events.

trans-unit.source: Multiple checkboxes can share the same event handler.
trans-unit.target: Multiple checkboxes can share the same event handler.

trans-unit.source: This example creates four checkboxes for selecting pizza toppings.
trans-unit.target: This example creates four checkboxes for selecting pizza toppings.

trans-unit.source: The four checkboxes share the same **Click** event handler to update the list of selected toppings.
trans-unit.target: The four checkboxes share the same **Click** event handler to update the list of selected toppings.

trans-unit.source: Here's the event handler for the Click event.
trans-unit.target: Here's the event handler for the Click event.

trans-unit.source: Every time a checkbox is clicked, it examines the checkboxes to see which ones are checked and update list of selected toppings.
trans-unit.target: Every time a checkbox is clicked, it examines the checkboxes to see which ones are checked and update list of selected toppings.

trans-unit.source: Use the indeterminate state
trans-unit.target: Use the indeterminate state

trans-unit.source: The CheckBox control inherits from [ToggleButton](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.primitives.togglebutton.aspx) and can have three states:
trans-unit.target: The CheckBox control inherits from [ToggleButton](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.primitives.togglebutton.aspx) and can have three states:

trans-unit.target: State

trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.target: checked

trans-unit.target: IsChecked

trans-unit.target: true

trans-unit.target: unchecked

trans-unit.target: IsChecked

trans-unit.target: indeterminate

trans-unit.target: IsChecked

trans-unit.target: null

trans-unit.source: For the check box to report the indeterminate state, you must set the [**IsThreeState**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.primitives.togglebutton.isthreestate.aspx) property to **true**.
trans-unit.target: For the check box to report the indeterminate state, you must set the [**IsThreeState**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.controls.primitives.togglebutton.isthreestate.aspx) property to **true**.

trans-unit.source: When options can be grouped, you can use an indeterminate check box to represent the whole group.
trans-unit.target: When options can be grouped, you can use an indeterminate check box to represent the whole group.

trans-unit.source: Use the check box's indeterminate state when a user selects some, but not all, sub-items in the group.
trans-unit.target: Use the check box's indeterminate state when a user selects some, but not all, sub-items in the group.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, the "Select all" checkbox has its IsThreeState property set to **true**.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, the "Select all" checkbox has its IsThreeState property set to **true**.

trans-unit.source: The "Select all" checkbox is checked if all child elements are checked, unchecked if all child elements are unchecked, and indeterminate otherwise.
trans-unit.target: The "Select all" checkbox is checked if all child elements are checked, unchecked if all child elements are unchecked, and indeterminate otherwise.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: Verify that the purpose and current state of the check box is clear.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the purpose and current state of the check box is clear.

trans-unit.source: Limit check box text content to no more than two lines.
trans-unit.target: Limit check box text content to no more than two lines.

trans-unit.source: Word the checkbox label as a statement that the check mark makes true and the absence of a check mark makes false.
trans-unit.target: Word the checkbox label as a statement that the check mark makes true and the absence of a check mark makes false.

trans-unit.source: Use the default font unless your brand guidelines tell you to use another.
trans-unit.target: Use the default font unless your brand guidelines tell you to use another.

trans-unit.source: If the text content is dynamic, consider how the control will resize and what will happen to visuals around it.
trans-unit.target: If the text content is dynamic, consider how the control will resize and what will happen to visuals around it.

trans-unit.source: If there are two or more mutually exclusive options from which to choose, consider using [radio buttons](radio-button.md).
trans-unit.target: If there are two or more mutually exclusive options from which to choose, consider using [radio buttons](radio-button.md).

trans-unit.source: Don't put two check box groups next to each other.
trans-unit.target: Don't put two check box groups next to each other.

trans-unit.source: Use group labels to separate the groups.
trans-unit.target: Use group labels to separate the groups.

trans-unit.source: Don't use a check box as an on/off control or to perform a command; instead, use a toggle switch.
trans-unit.target: Don't use a check box as an on/off control or to perform a command; instead, use a toggle switch.

trans-unit.source: Don't use a check box to display other controls, such as a dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Don't use a check box to display other controls, such as a dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Use the indeterminate state to indicate that an option is set for some, but not all, sub-choices.
trans-unit.target: Use the indeterminate state to indicate that an option is set for some, but not all, sub-choices.

trans-unit.source: When using indeterminate state, use subordinate check boxes to show which options are selected and which are not.
trans-unit.target: When using indeterminate state, use subordinate check boxes to show which options are selected and which are not.

trans-unit.source: Design the UI so that the user can get see the sub-choices.
trans-unit.target: Design the UI so that the user can get see the sub-choices.

trans-unit.source: Don't use the indeterminate state to represent a third state.
trans-unit.target: Don't use the indeterminate state to represent a third state.

trans-unit.source: The indeterminate state is used to indicate that an option is set for some, but not all, sub-choices.
trans-unit.target: The indeterminate state is used to indicate that an option is set for some, but not all, sub-choices.

trans-unit.source: So, don't allow users to set an indeterminate state directly.
trans-unit.target: So, don't allow users to set an indeterminate state directly.

trans-unit.source: For an example of what not to do, this check box uses the indeterminate state to indicate medium spiciness:
trans-unit.target: For an example of what not to do, this check box uses the indeterminate state to indicate medium spiciness:

trans-unit.source: An indeterminate check box
trans-unit.target: An indeterminate check box

trans-unit.source: Instead, use a radio button group that has three options: Not spicy, Spicy, and Extra spicy.
trans-unit.target: Instead, use a radio button group that has three options: Not spicy, Spicy, and Extra spicy.

trans-unit.source: Radio button group with three options: Not spicy, Spicy, and Extra spicy
trans-unit.target: Radio button group with three options: Not spicy, Spicy, and Extra spicy
